intro: Pimpinella lithophila, commonly known as the limestone pimpinella, is a flowering plant native to rocky, calcareous environments. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in crevices of limestone rocks, thriving in well-drained, alkaline soils. It is often found in Mediterranean regions and has adapted to harsh, sun-exposed conditions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species in certain areas.
